TopicTitle: Four radiators have the same energy consumption

Articles.Content:
Currently four of the radiator options have the exact same rate of energy consumption; does this make sense? Maybe the energy consumption is from a pump pumping coolant, in which case it makes sense to have the same energy consumption regardless of size but if there's more to it then maybe they should have different rates of consumption?

Right now, I think the best bang for energy buck is the small folding radiator, right?

Edited July 9, 2016 by THX1138

In CPU terms, it's the same "fan" with a bigger "heatsink", I guess.   All else being equal, a bigger radiator ought to radiate faster and more efficiently.  So, I'm not sure this is really wrong.

Edited July 11, 2016 by Corona688
